content: brown yarn round 1 chain 2 work 5 single_crochet into 1st chain - 5 st round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around - 10 st round 3 5 3 rounds single_crochet in each st around 10 st fo leaving enough yarn to sew to head use the light grey/brown yarn to embroider little lines on the tips of the ears to look like the fur on wicket s ears ------------------------------------------------------------------------ this is the second type of head i tried using mohair for the face head version 2 start from the front of the face using mohair yarn round 1 chain 2 work 6 single_crochet into 1st chain - 6 st round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around - 12 st round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 6 times - 18 st round 4 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 2 st 6 times - 24 st 4 round 5 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 3 st 6 times - 30 st change to brown yarn round 6 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 4 st 6 times - 36 st round 7 12 6 rounds single_crochet in each st around 36 st fluff the mohair up a bit using a wire brush and then fit the eyes between rounds 3 and 4 round 13 decrease single_crochet in next 4 st 6 times 30 st round 14 decrease single_crochet in next 3 st 6 times 24 st round 15 decrease single_crochet in next 2 st 6 times 18 st round 16 decrease single_crochet in next st 6 times 12 st round 17 decrease 6 times 6 st fo leaving a tail of yarn partially stuff the head to give it some shape and then embroider the features it helps to look at photos of the real wicket use brown yarn or thread for the nose and mouth and white for the teeth if wished i did the nose with horizontal lines ending with 3 separate parts to give the effect of nostrils for the mouth i did 2 horizontal lines then embroidered vertically over each of them to make the lips the teeth are little vertical lines stuff firmly and sew the hole up neatly ears version 2 make 2 using mohair round 1 chain 2 work 5 single_crochet into 1st chain - 5 st round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around - 10 st round 3 single_crochet in each st around 10 st change to brown yarn round 4 5 2 rounds single_crochet in each st around 10 st fo leaving enough yarn to sew to head fluff the mohair up a bit using a wire brush you might need to trim it if it s too long arms from fingers up make 2 start with cream yarn fingers are not worked in rounds chain 7 miss 1st chain 3 double_crochet pop in next chain single_crochet in next chain 3 times change to brown yarn
